6.verification_summary: The claim states that AdaBoost and Gradient Boosting achieved recall around 0.90 with precision around 0.1 in fraud detection, implying many false positives.

10.verification_summary: The claim reflects a common challenge in fraud datasets with extreme class imbalance and a typical response involving SMOTE and precision-recall considerations, though the strength of evidence and methodological details are not specified in the claim text.

11.verification_summary: The claim reflects the standard precision recall trade off in fraud detection where reducing false positives lowers operational alerts while false negatives allow fraud, suggesting a practical objective to minimize false positives while preserving recall.

12.verification_summary: The claim lists plausible future work directions commonly considered in machine learning research, aligning with typical limitations and expansion areas.

13.verification_summary: Based on the claim, high recall with low precision leads to many false alarms; Random Forest generally has better precision and balances security and usability in detection tasks.
